original_title: Sri Lanka-Thailand Business Council holds 21st AGM, elects new Ex-Co
original_body_lines: The Sri Lanka-Thailand Business Council’s New Executive Committee for the Year 2023/2024  From left: Treasurer Asim Mukthar, Vice President Kamil Weerasekara, Founder and Past President Rizan Nazeer, President Dushyantha Basnayake, Thai Ambassador to Sri Lanka Poj Harnpol, Founder and Past President Lionel Fernando, Immediate Past President Lalith Kumarage, Vice President A.M. Musajee, and Secretary Priyantha Kolonnage.

Standing from left: Assistant Treasurer Yashoda Pieris, Committee Member Abdul Saliheen, Committee Member Venura Fernando, Minister Counsellor Arthit Prasartkul, Committee Member Rienzie Fernando, Committee Member Chandana Nanayakkara, Committee Member Rohan Elgiriyawithana, First Secretary Peerapat Thongrod.  (Absent: Assistant Secretary Asitha Panabokke, Committee Member Sampath Pilapitiya, and Committee Member Deepal Abeysekara)

The Sri Lanka-Thailand Business Council held its 21st Annual General Meeting at Siam House, Melbourne Avenue, Colombo recently. Following the AGM, the committee paid a courtesy call to Thailand Ambassador to Sri Lanka Poj Harnpol and had a successful discussion about strengthening the bilateral trade between the two countries and the advantage of having an FDA between Sri Lanka and Thailand.
